response.content:
{
  "step1": "Preheat oven to 350°F. Prepare two 8-inch round cake pans with butter and flour. Mix 2 ¾ cups all-purpose flour, 1 ½ cups granulated sugar, 2 teaspoons baking powder, and 1 teaspoon salt in a medium bowl.",
  "step2": "In a large mixing bowl, combine 1 cup unsweetened cocoa powder and 1 cup whole milk, stirring until smooth. Add 2 large eggs and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, whisking until well combined.",
  "step3": "Gradually add dry ingredients to the cocoa mixture, whisking until smooth. Melt 1 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips and ½ cup unsalted butter, then let cool slightly. Fold into the batter until well combined.",
  "step4": "Divide batter evenly between prepared pans and smooth tops. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Let cool in pans for 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack.",
  "step5": "For frosting, melt 1 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips and ½ cup unsalted butter. Whisk in 1 ¾ cups powdered sugar and 2 tablespoons milk until smooth. Let cool and thicken before assembling the cake.",
  "step6": "Assemble cake by spreading frosting on top of one layer, then stacking the second layer. Frost the outside of the cake with remaining frosting. Decorate as desired and serve to 8 people." 
}
